entries.meaning: (law) A contract preceding another, especially a contract of marriage which, according to the ancient law, rendered void a subsequent marriage solemnized in violation of it.
examples: Two grounds are surmised , by opposite parties : a pre-contract with Percy , Earl of Northumberland ; and an adulterous intercourse of Henry , many years preceding , with Anne's sister , Mary Boleyn.

verbs.description: precontract (third-person singular simple present precontracts, present participle precontracting, simple past and past participle precontracted)

entries.meaning: To contract prior to another process.
